item.title: Morea
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Morea

In the year 2082, beautiful Morea Doloniac is an ordinary employee in one of the biggest meta-national companies on the planet, the DWC. One day, she is nearly killed when commando squads execute, everywhere on the planet, members of her family. As the only survivor, she finds herself at the head of one of the main economic powers of the XXIth century.

More mysterious, the attempt on her life was a success…

She died… And yet, she is still alive!

Morea

In the year 2082, beautiful Morea Doloniac is an ordinary employee in one of the biggest meta-national companies on the planet, the DWC. One day, she is nearly killed when commando squads execute, everywhere on the planet, members of her family. As the only survivor, she finds herself at the head of one of the main economic powers of the XXIth century.

More mysterious, the attempt on her life was a success…

She died… And yet, she is still alive!

item.title: Approved for Adoption
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Approved for Adoption

JUNG WAS WANDERING THE STREETS OF SEOUL WHEN A POLICEMAN TOOK HIM TO AN AMERICAN ORPHANAGE. HE WAS FIVE YEARS OLD.

A FEW PHOTOS, A REPORT FROM THE ORPHANAGE… HIS MEMORIES HANG BY A THREAD. BUT QUESTIONS STILL HAUNT HIM.

In 2007, Jung decides to plunge himself into the memories or the fantasies of his life - he wants to reconcile a period tinged with uncertainty that eats away at him. He talks about himself in this terribly intimate tale, his survival in Korea, his new Belgian family. An adoption that was not always very successful, contrary to some other kids. But this story is his. Giggles, dramas, everyday life, kids’ stupid things and questions without answers…

He grew up with it, built himself with it, day after day, somehow or another.

With the friendly authorization from Rainbow World, GKIDS and Wide Management for the use of the English title.

He talks about himself in this terribly intimate tale, his survival in Korea, his new Belgian family. An adoption that was not always very successful, contrary to some other kids. item.title: Master Inquisitors
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

The Master Inquisitors

1150, The Chaos, a war that ravaged the Oscitan territories for a thousand years, comes to an end.

For order and law to prevail, both during and after the war, the Mages created an Order - The Master Inquisitors - to fight crime and uphold justice.

But if there is one thing that the Mages truly succeeded at during the conflict, it was to cause hatred, distrust, fear, contempt, and discord…

The Master Inquisitors

item.title: Ythaq
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Ythaq

A luxury cruise ship crashes on Ythaq, a planet that is curiously listed nowhere. Among the survivors, the beautiful and intrepid sailor, Granite, a young technician, Narvarth, and a gorgeous, but unscrupulous passenger, Callista. These three survivors will have to join forces if they want to survive this inhospitable place…

item.title: Dwarves
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Dwarves

ONE WRITER, FIVE ARTISTS, AND A GREAT PEOPLE - THE DWARVES!

In the old days, united around a sole King, Dwarves dominated the mountain realms.

When the great schism split them into a multitude of fortress-states, they divided knowledge between the four main Orders, the Forge, the Talion, the Temple, and the Shield. Then a fifth one was created which included the outcasts and the underprivileged, the Order of the Wanderers.

Dwarves

item.title: Elves
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Elves

FIVE RACES IN THE SAME WORLD, FIVE WRITERS AND FIVE ILLUSTRATORS, FOR FIVE ENTHRALLING STORIES!

Set against the backdrop of a shared world, five creative teams explore differing aspects of this Fantasy universe. Each pairing - writer and illustrator - bring their own vision of the world to life, while all five stories together paint a vivid image of this unique setting.

War of the World War One
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

War of the World War One

In 1916, during the battle of Verdun, a huge German mine destroys an important French fort and kills general Nivelle. However, the explosion uncovers a strange and massive machine which had been buried in the ground beneath the fort for centuries.

Druids
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Druids

A new threat challenges the vestiges of the old neolithic cults…

In the Fifth Century, the World is changing. A conflict has begun between Christianity and the ancient religions.

In the Shade, druids and monks are engaged in a war. As the Bretons occupy the rocky headland of Armorique, Gwenc’ hlan, the last druid of this region, and Taran, his apprentice, try to thwart the traps set by their fanatical opponents. To succeed, they will need the help of Morrigane, a woman of the Other World…

item.title: Ekho
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Ekho

When Fourmille gets on her plane for New York, she has no idea how strange a direction her journey will take. In the middle of the flight, she is accosted by a strange creature who asks her if she accepts the inheritance of an aunt who disappeared 20 years ago. And after lightning strikes the 747, it is on a dragon’s back that she lands in a very different New York! Deep in a fantastic Manhattan, she discovers the completely offbeat world of Ekho!

item.title: Angor
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Angor

A five-issue limited series.

TO ESCAPE FROM THEIR MISERABLE EXISTENCE, THREE TEENAGERS TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR DESTINY.

Three teenagers, Talinn, Evrane, and the very young Corky, live in a small village in the vast Kingdom of Angor. As members of the lowest caste, their future is all mapped out; they have to till the soil and raise livestock alongside their parents. However, all three dream of chivalry, adventure, and freedom. But if they want to be masters of their own destiny, they have to leave the City, no matter the cost.

Angor

A five-issue limited series.

item.title: Elves v17 - The Black Blood of the Sylvan Elves (2017) (digital) (The Magicians-Empire).cbr
Androids
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

Androids

A NEW CONCEPT SERIES, FEATURING FOUR COMPLETE STORIES OF SCIENCE FICTION, THAT EXPLORES THE ANDROID AND HUMAN CONDITIONS.

1- A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.

2- A robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law.

3- A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws.

(The Three Laws of Robotics, Isaac Asimov)

Androids

The Centron Files
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

The Centron Files

A three-issue limited series.

A gigantic megalopolis, Centron, suffers from three troubles: a rise in sea level and pollution due to climate change, a shortage of everything, and chronic overpopulation.

That is why, every year, over 400,000 citizens, selected by the computer ATROPOS, are eliminated during what is called Egalitarian Control. A delicate mission entrusted to a special elite force, nicknamed Weasels.

A SERIES OF UNEXPLAINED EVENTS ARE AFFLICTING THE WORLD, DAY AFTER DAY, AT 13:13 PM EXACTLY.

As the threat of Apocalypse hangs over the whole planet, it would seem that the future of Humanity has been plunged into chaos and obscurity… Heralding the worst for civilization.

Husk

A two-issue limited series.

In the near future, the Arnold company makes “Husks”, biomechanical entities five meters high that provide an anatomical continuation of the body of their pilot.

The new biomeca “M5” Husk is the result of the exceptional efforts deployed by the engineers of Arnold to satisfy all requirements; on all grounds, for military operations, maintenance of law and order, extreme rescue, or for space exploration, the new Arnold “M5” excels in all situations!

The Curse of the Wendigo
item.description:
æ‰“åŒ…ä¸‹è½½ğŸ“¦ä»åœ¨å·¥äº‹ä¸­

The Curse of the Wendigo

The Great War, July 1917. At an isolated stretch of the Front, French and German soldiers kill each other in an endless carnage…

The night air is rent by sentries’ screams. Everyone in the French camp thinks it’s a trap laid by the enemy, but soon they hear screams from the German lines… With both factions being hunted, they are obliged to declare a uneasy truce and send a team of men to solve the mystery. With them goes Wohati, a Cree Warrior, one of the 12,000 Indians in the U.S. Army, and the only man who knows what’s waiting out there…

The Curse of the Wendigo

The Great War, July 1917. At an isolated stretch of the Front, French and German soldiers kill each other in an endless carnage…

The night air is rent by sentries’ screams. Everyone in the French camp thinks it’s a trap laid by the enemy, but soon they hear screams from the German lines… With both factions being hunted, they are obliged to declare a uneasy truce and send a team of men to solve the mystery. With them goes Wohati, a Cree Warrior, one of the 12,000 Indians in the U.S. Army, and the only man who knows what’s waiting out there…
